text: We need an internet of shit award
"you turn a rainy day into an exciting day”
a former Google client contact made a smart umbrella stand <http://www.psfk.com/2015/10/smart-umbrella-stand-raincheck-box-check-the-weather.html>

attachments.title: Smart Umbrella Stand Can Tell You If It's Going to Rain
attachments.text: Raincheck, a smart umbrella stand, updates weather data every 15 minutes to let you know whether you'll need cover when leaving the house.
attachments.fallback: PSFK: Smart Umbrella Stand Can Tell You If It's Going to Rain

text: wonder why they put the tech in the stand and not the handle? Power?
"the revolution will link technology and design to create “beautiful, smart reincarnations of what used to be ordinary household and personal objects.”"
Lots of sleep-related "smart objects" mentioned in this article: <http://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/jun/01/sleep-habits-eight-hours-health-wellness-arianna-huffington>

attachments.title: How a good night's sleep became the ultimate status symbol
attachments.text: Arianna Huffington espouses the virtues of eight hours and luxury products promise rejuvenating rest, but who can really afford to sleep safe and sound?
attachments.fallback: the Guardian: How a good night's sleep became the ultimate status symbol
